meanings.definition: To make something illegal or punishable by law.
meanings.sent1: The new law will criminalize texting while driving.
meanings.sent2: It is important to criminalize harmful activities to protect society.
meanings.sent3: I heard they want to criminalize eating ice cream on Mondays!
meanings.sent4: In this town, they criminalize any form of littering.
meanings.sent5: The mayor's goal is to criminalize pollution to keep the environment clean.

meanings.definition: To declare an action or behavior as a crime.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to criminalize tax evasion.
meanings.sent2: Society must criminalize violence to maintain peace.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if they criminalize wearing mismatched socks!
meanings.sent4: His actions seemed to criminalize any form of dissent.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to criminalize cheating to uphold academic integrity.
